presentation: I create accessible, high-performance interfaces with sharp SEO ‚Äî all focused on the end user. Currently open to full-time opportunities while working on freelance projects.
aboutMeParagraph1: Hi! I'm Larissa Cristina Benedito, also known as Mewmew ‚Äî a Software Developer passionate about Front-End and an explorer of the Back-End universe. I am passionate about digital accessibility, Open Source projects, and initiatives with a social purpose. I believe technology should be made by and for everyone.
aboutMeParagraph2: I graduated in Digital Games from Faculdade Impacta, with a full scholarship from Instituto IT M√≠dia and Instituto da Oportunidade Social (TOTVS). I am also a student at 42 S√£o Paulo ‚Äî one of the best Software Engineering schools in the world.
aboutMeParagraph3: In my free time, I work as a Web Designer and Illustrator, leading projects from start to finish: from prototyping to development, testing, and publishing. I have experience collaborating with multidisciplinary and international teams, always adapting solutions to the realities and cultures of each project.
aboutMeParagraph4: In the tech community, I am a Volunteer Tutor at PrograMona, a Web Development training program promoted by PrograMaria in partnership with Casa 1 üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà . The initiative is aimed at including LGBTQIAP+ people and underrepresented groups in technology. I also volunteer at events like CryptoRave (focused on digital security), DevOpsDays SP, hackathons, and game jams ‚Äî where I mix creativity, collaboration, and innovation in diverse environments.
aboutMeParagraph5: I advocate for free software, access to information, and knowledge sharing as pillars for fairer and more inclusive technology. I am constantly learning, guided by the philosophy that has always driven me: ‚ÄúAlways in development.‚Äù
aboutMeParagraph6: If you're looking for a creative, dedicated developer with an eye for detail, whether for a one-off project or ongoing collaboration, I'd be happy to chat! üíå
